history.content:
It doesn't really make sense to me to take stat 140 with cs70. I think workload will be too high. Just take eecs126 after cs70 if you want more probability. Stat 140 requires data 8 probabilty background.

--

Different anon here. I took 140 and 70 together and found it to be a good combination. It may be a bit tough at the beginning, but 140 really helped me understand the second half of 70 well and the workload for 70 became pretty light for me towards the end because I spent less time struggling to understand the concepts. Of course you'll get the most out of taking 70 and then 126, but if you're feeling shaky about your mathematical maturity and need a good grade to declare the major like I did, I think it would be a good idea to take both. Having a solid 140/70 level probability foundation is probably better than barely surviving 126 even if 140 + 70 seems a bit redundant. Also, 140 covers quite a few things that 70 doesn't teach such as MCMC, MLE, multivariate normals, etc.

It doesn't really make sense to me to take stat 140 with cs70. I think workload will be too high. Just take eecs126 after cs70 if you want more probability. Stat 140 requires data 8 probabilty background.
Also does anyone know if stat 140 has webcast?

children.subject: Also does anyone know if stat 140 has webcast?

history.content:
Hi All,

I'm a second year CS major urgently need some advice on class enrollment. Given that I have no background in probability except for data 8&100 and only have taken math 54 and cal from high school for math background, if I want to take CS70 with Stat140 next semester, is the workload doable? If 140 is too hard then are there any alternative probability courses for cs majors?

I heard that the second half of 70 overlaps with 140 so I guess it will help a little. If I want to study during winter break, what material should I start with regarding 70 and 140?

Thanks! ;)
history.subject: SP20: CS70 with Stat140?
